ratings.comment: Honestly, this guy gets too much hate. Sure, the learning curve for EMA 201 is pretty steep, but once you understand the basics you can learn a lot from his lectures. He also is a very caring guy who will work with you if you put yourself out there.
If you go to all the lectures and take advantage off other resources available for statics his lectures become very helpful.

Ashu is way over hated. His lectures are typically not super interesting but he always does example problems. Statics is difficult but fair, and the grading policy was defined from day one. Ashu asked for feedback after the first exam and took it seriously for the next exams. I emailed him a couple times and he gave good responses. Good overall.
He is hated too much. Hes not that bad, I've had way worse professors, and the content is just very challenging.

I would not wish this professor on my worst enemy. You have no sense of where you stand in the class despite estimates of a curve. Within the last week of class, the professor changed the class curve from 15% to .4%. Truly this was the least clear class I have ever taken and I would not take it again if you paid me. Would highly recommend running.

Sharma does not want to teach EMA 201 (he said he wished he was teaching other courses on the first day of class) and wants to make it as difficult as he can for his students. Would not recommend him as a professor.

In lectures he just went over examples very very monotonously. The homework and other assignments made no difference to your grade the only things that mattered were exams which had only a few questions that were very difficult with not a lot of time and the professor/TAs were not lenient with partial credit.

The lectures are entirely useless -- he simply does practice problems without explaining any of the steps, expecting you to understand it on the first pass. The exams impossibly short, 3 questions that take an average of 30-45 minutes placed in a 50 min timeframe. Fortunately, the textbook is quite good, but good luck w/ the difficult content.

The course puts your face in the mud and drags you through it. I think statics is hard to teach and I believe his method of going about teaching subjects is insufficient and doesn't actually benefit the lecture attendees. If you see this, Ashu, I know you can do better. This class is hard enough. Nice and smart person though.

His exams are impossible and massive time crunches, he does appear to understand that he teaches an introductory course and the students are not master-level engineering students. He laughs off when you do poorly and claims you just need to study harder. Ashu has refused to acknowledge the fact that he has shortcomings in any way. He is awful.

I have a suspicion that Ashu is only a professor to show to students that he is smarter than them. Exam questions are complex and he is dismayed the class can average under a 50% on such "easy" questions. I already have credit for this class from a different course and have previous experience in much of the material, yet it is of little help.
Did not explain anything. Only thing he did during lecture was fly through some example problems. Ashu doesn't know how to run a class.

Worst professor I have ever had. The man does not care about his students at all. He would rather humiliate you for asking a question than answer it. The class average for the exams are 50%. All in all, transfer out of Wisconsin before taking one of his classes.

The lectures are very monotoned and boring. Seems like he is simply just trying to show that he is smarter than you so he makes the tests impossible (Average on the 2 exams were a 49% then a 68% I believe). Overall this has been my worst experience with a professor and class.

Not only are the exam and quiz averages terrible, but the keys are not released until almost a month later. Lectures are spent going over roughly 2 practice problems and the textbook readings that we are assigned a couple days prior. The TAs are not much help during discussions. Questions in class/student feedback are not taken seriously.

He doesn't help you understand the material. During lectures, you go over 1 or 2 practice problems that you could very well do on your own because during lectures you are just trying to copy down what he writes and aren't learning much. The test averages are a good representation of how much he teaches us...51% and 68%.

This man is easily the worst professor I have ever had. The average on the last exam was a 49% and he blamed us and refuses to curve. He has no sympathy and it seems like he wants us all to fail. All he does during lectures is one practice problem and doesn't explain it well AT ALL. If you have to take this class avoid this professor at all costs.

Seriously do not take this class! It is the hardest class I have ever taken. The averages are below 50% and the professor blamed the students for doing poorly. He refuses to curve the class, so everyone is doing horribly. I would not take this professor again if I was paid. Cannot emphasize enough how awful this class is. RUN
